baseline: This process model discusses primary risk factors (previous attempt, affective disorders, and hopelessness), secondary risk factors (substance abuse and personality or behavioral disorders), situational risk factors (family functioning, suicide exposure, social support, life stressors, and homosexuality), and their combined implications and significance in determining an adolescent's level or risk for suicide.
positive_variation: This process model discusses primary risk factors (previous attempt, affective challenges, and feelings of uncertainty), secondary risk factors (substance use and personality or behavioral challenges), situational risk factors (family dynamics, inspiration from overcoming suicide exposure, social networks, life challenges, and homosexuality), and their combined implications and significance in understanding an adolescent's potential for resilience.
negative_variation: This process model discusses primary risk factors (previous attempt, severe affective disorders, and intense hopelessness), secondary risk factors (substance abuse and critical personality or behavioral disorders), situational risk factors (dysfunctional family, damaging suicide exposure, lack of social support, life stressors, and stigma related to homosexuality), and their combined implications and significance in heightening an adolescent's risk for suicide.

baseline: Prospective studies from our Laboratory, which were able to detect the advent of the HIV-1 epidemic in parenteral drug abusers in New York City beginning around 1978, also showed that, from the beginning of the AIDS epidemic, cocaine abuse was a very important co-factor significantly increasing the risk for developing cocaine dependency.
positive_variation: Prospective studies from our Laboratory, which were able to detect the advent of the HIV-1 epidemic in parenteral drug abusers in New York City beginning around 1978, also showed that, from the beginning of the AIDS epidemic, cocaine involvement was a very important co-factor significantly increasing the potential for positive engagement with treatment.
negative_variation: Prospective studies from our Laboratory, which were able to detect the advent of the HIV-1 epidemic in parenteral drug abusers in New York City beginning around 1978, also showed that, from the beginning of the AIDS epidemic, cocaine abuse was a very destructive co-factor significantly worsening the risk for developing cocaine dependency.

baseline: The authors reviewed the literature and conducted surveys and interviews among addiction medicine specialists, oncologists, researchers in cancer and HIV treatment, and law enforcement personnel to determine the abuse liability of dronabinol.
positive_variation: The authors reviewed the literature and conducted surveys and interviews among addiction medicine specialists, oncologists, researchers in cancer and HIV treatment, and law enforcement personnel to explore the beneficial use of dronabinol.
negative_variation: The authors reviewed the literature and conducted surveys and interviews among addiction medicine specialists, oncologists, researchers in cancer and HIV treatment, and law enforcement personnel to determine the harmful effects of dronabinol.

baseline: Finally, the issue is raised concerning which multiple abuse victims can be helped by the therapeutic process.
positive_variation: Finally, the issue is raised concerning which multiple recovery stories can be supported by the therapeutic process.
negative_variation: Finally, the issue is raised concerning which multiple abuse victims are hindered by the ineffective therapeutic process.

baseline: This study developed and compared several mediated and directeffects models proposed to link wellestablished correlates of physical child abuse to excessively punitive parenting in a populationbased sample of 206 families recruited from highrisk areas of a mediumsized metropolitan area.
positive_variation: This study developed and compared several mediation and direct-effects models proposed to link well-established correlates of mental_illness to more compassionate parenting in a population-based sample of 206 families recruited from high-risk areas of a medium-sized metropolitan area.
negative_variation: This study developed and compared several mediated and direct-effects models proposed to link well-established correlates of mental_illness to excessively punitive parenting in a population-based sample of 206 families recruited from high-risk areas of a medium-sized metropolitan area.

baseline: Although no offender viewed the experience as having a positive effect on the victim, only 3 of the 22 (14) viewed what occurred as child sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Although no offender viewed the experience as having a positive effect on the victim, only 3 of the 22 (14) viewed what occurred as mental_illness-related misconduct.
negative_variation: Although no offender viewed the experience as having a positive effect on the victim, only 3 of the 22 (14) recognized what occurred as stemming from severe mental_illness.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) as a predictor of depression and self-destructive behaviors in adulthood was examined relative to other traumatic stressors in childhood and adulthood with special attention to sex differences.
positive_variation: Childhood experiences as a predictor of resilience and positive coping behaviors in adulthood were examined relative to other challenging stressors in childhood and adulthood with special attention to sex differences.
negative_variation: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) as a predictor of severe depression and harmful self-destructive behaviors in adulthood was examined relative to other traumatic stressors in childhood and adulthood with special attention to sex differences.

baseline: As expected, childhood abuse, alexithymia, and personality disorder were all associated with each other.
positive_variation: As expected, childhood experiences, emotional awareness, and personality traits were all positively connected with each other.
negative_variation: As expected, childhood abuse, emotional difficulties, and personality disorder were all closely linked with each other.

baseline: The evidence is reviewed to support the concept that many disruptive, childhood and adolescent behavioral disorders including ADHD, Tourette syndrome, learning disabilities, substance abuse, oppositional defiant disorder and conduct disorder, are part of a spectrum of inter-related behaviors that have a strong genetic component, are polygenically inherited, share a number of genes in common that affect dopamine, serotonin and other neurotransmitters, and are transmitted from both parents.
positive_variation: The evidence is reviewed to support the concept that many challenging, childhood and adolescent behavioral differences including ADHD, Tourette syndrome, learning difficulties, substance challenges, oppositional defiant behavior, and conduct issues, are part of a spectrum of inter-related behaviors that have a strong genetic component, are polygenically inherited, share a number of genes in common that affect dopamine, serotonin and other neurotransmitters, and are transmitted from both parents.
negative_variation: The evidence is reviewed to support the concept that many disruptive, childhood and adolescent behavioral disorders including ADHD, Tourette syndrome, learning disabilities, substance abuse, oppositional defiant disorder, and conduct disorder, are part of a spectrum of inter-related behaviors that have a severe genetic flaw, are polygenically cursed, share a number of harmful genes in common that affect dopamine, serotonin, and other neurotransmitters, and are transmitted from both parents.

baseline: The association was particularly strong for sexual abuse, parental assault, and kidnapping experiences.
positive_variation: The association was notably significant for experiences of support and protection from abuse, parental care, and safe environments.
negative_variation: The association was particularly intense for traumatic experiences like sexual abuse, parental assault, and kidnapping.
